name: subversiveness
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
behaviour or activities that try to destroy or damage something, especially an established political system: Many people have written about the subversiveness of the story's plot. The novel was banned once the authorities understood the subversiveness of its subject. See
subversive
More examplesFewer examplesHe has still got a dark streak of subversiveness about him.Their flowery language covers a hidden subversiveness. The prisoners respond to their captors' brutality with resistance, subversiveness or bitter resentment.
